DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value to represent the interference from prostate cancer symptoms with normal urinary function causing loss of urine retention due to failed control of urinary bladder sphincters.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Prostate Quality of Life Urinary Control Symptom
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: related to changes in normal urinary function causing loss of urine retention due to failed control of urinary bladder sphincters due to interference from symptoms of prostate cancer.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A gland in the male reproductive system just below the bladder. It surrounds part of the urethra, the canal that empties the bladder. It produces a fluid that forms part of semen. (NCI-GLOSS):The subjective measurement of an individual's sense of well-being and ability to enjoy life.  The concept holds varying meanings for different people and may evolve over time. For some individuals it implies autonomy, empowerment, capability, and choice; for others, security, social integration, or freedom from stress or illness.

Concepts.definition: The walnut shaped accessory sex gland of the male reproductive system. It is located in the pelvis just below the bladder, surrounding the prostatic part of the urethra. The prostate gland secretes a fluid which is part of the semen.

The subjective measurement of an individual's sense of well-being and ability to enjoy life. The concept holds varying meanings for different people and may evolve over time. For some individuals it implies autonomy, empowerment, capability, and choice; for others, security, social integration, or freedom from stress or illness.

Property.preferredDefinition: Having to do with urine or the organs of the body that produce and get rid of urine.:The act of directing or determining; regulation or maintenance of a function or action; a relation of constraint of one entity (thing or person or group) by another.:An indication that a person has a condition or disease.  Some examples of symptoms are headache, fever, fatigue, nausea, vomiting, and pain.

Concepts.definition: Urinary; of or relating to urine, of or relating to the urinary system, or of or relating to the function or production or secretion of urine.
The act of directing or determining; regulation or maintenance of a function or action; a relation of constraint of one entity (thing or person or group) by another.
Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: information on quality of patient life and ability to function

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: a scaled set of values rating interference from prostate cancer symptoms with normal urinary function causing loss of urine retention due to failed control of urinary bladder sphincters.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective response indicating that an individual frequently dribbles urine.

Concepts.definition: A subjective response indicating that an individual frequently dribbles urine.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective response indicating that an individual has or had no urinary control.

Concepts.definition: A subjective response indicating that an individual has or had no urinary control.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective response indicating that an individual occasionally dribbles urine.

Concepts.definition: A subjective response indicating that an individual occasionally dribbles urine.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ValueDomain.origin: CALGB CRF:Cancer and Leukemia Group B Case Report Form
